text.p: WCE canola and grain futures pre-opening call as of 0837 CDT.

CANOLA - C$0.50 to C$1.00 a tonne lower on CBOT soycomplex calls with losses limited by forecasts for a slight chance of frost in southern Alberta on Sunday although the trade is sceptical a frost could come as early as August 17. November WCE canola crush profit margin fell to -20.78 Tuesday from -19.87 Monday. Canada's dollar opened flat at C$1.3925, rose to 83.75 yen and fell to 1.3293 marks.
FLAXSEED - C$0.50 to C$1.00 down in sympathy with allied markets.
WESTERN BARLEY - C$1.00 to C$2.00 a tonne higher on CBOT corn calls. Trade talk of low test weights in Alberta's barley crop should continue to be supportive.
FEED WHEAT - C$1.00 to C$2.00 a tonne up on spill over support from WCE barley and CBOT corn calls.
(All values in Canadian dollars/tonne except peas, oats)
